title: File Deletion
descrption: Malware, tools, or other non-native files dropped or created on a system by an adversary may leave traces behind as to what was done within a network and how. Adversaries may remove these files over the course of an intrusion to keep their footprint low or remove them at the end as part of the post-intrusion cleanup process.There are tools available from the host operating system to perform cleanup, but adversaries may use other tools as well. Examples include native cmd functions such as DEL, secure deletion tools such as Windows Sysinternals SDelete, or other third-party file deletion tools. [1]
Data Sources: File monitoring, Process command-line parameters, Binary file metadata

related.Name: ADVSTORESHELL
related.Description: ADVSTORESHELL can delete files and directories.[6]

related.Name: APT18
related.Description: APT18 actors deleted tools and batch files from victim systems.[127]

related.Name: APT28
related.Description: APT28 has intentionally deleted computer files to cover their tracks, including with use of the program CCleaner.[120]

related.Name: APT29
related.Description: APT29 used SDelete to remove artifacts from victims.[117]

related.Name: APT3
related.Description: APT3 has a tool that can delete files.[125]

related.Name: APT32
related.Description: APT32's macOS backdoor can receive a "delete" command.[128]

related.Name: APT38
related.Description: APT38 has used a utility called CLOSESHAVE that can securely delete a file from the system.[126]

related.Name: APT41
related.Description: APT41 deleted files from the system. [102]

related.Name: AuditCred
related.Description: AuditCred can delete files from the system.[81]

related.Name: Azorult
related.Description: Azorult can delete files from victim machines.[86]

related.Name: BabyShark
related.Description: BabyShark has cleaned up all files associated with the secondary payload execution.[105]

related.Name: Backdoor.Oldrea
related.Description: Backdoor.Oldrea contains a cleanup module that removes traces of itself from the victim.[64]

related.Name: Bankshot
related.Description: Bankshot marks files to be deleted upon the next system reboot and uninstalls and removes itself from the system.[69]

related.Name: BBSRAT
related.Description: BBSRAT can delete files and directories.[66]

related.Name: Bisonal
related.Description: Bisonal deletes its dropper and VBS scripts from the victim’s machine.[24]

related.Name: BLACKCOFFEE
related.Description: BLACKCOFFEE has the capability to delete files.[42]

related.Name: BRONZE BUTLER
related.Description: The BRONZE BUTLER uploader or malware the uploader uses command to delete the RAR archives after they have been exfiltrated.[115]

related.Name: Calisto
related.Description: Calisto has the capability to use rm -rf to remove folders and files from the victim's machine.[4]

related.Name: Carbanak
related.Description: Carbanak has a command to delete files.[5]

related.Name: Cardinal RAT
related.Description: Cardinal RAT can uninstall itself, including deleting its executable.[61]

related.Name: Cherry Picker
related.Description: Recent versions of Cherry Picker delete files and registry keys created by the malware.[9]

related.Name: cmd
related.Description: cmd can be used to delete files from the file system.[2]

related.Name: Cobalt Group
related.Description: Cobalt Group deleted the DLL dropper from the victim’s machine to cover their tracks.[7]

related.Name: Denis
related.Description: Denis has a command to delete files from the victim’s machine.[54][55]

related.Name: Derusbi
related.Description: Derusbi is capable of deleting files. It has been observed loading a Linux Kernel Module (LKM) and then deleting it from the hard disk as well as overwriting the data with null bytes.[82][37]

related.Name: Dragonfly 2.0
related.Description: Dragonfly 2.0 deleted many of its files used during operations as part of cleanup, including removing applications and deleting screenshots.[118][119]

related.Name: Elise
related.Description: Elise is capable of launching a remote shell on the host to delete itself.[75]

related.Name: Epic
related.Description: Epic has a command to delete a file from the machine.[33]

related.Name: EvilBunny
related.Description: EvilBunny has deleted the initial dropper after running through the environment checks.[99]

related.Name: FALLCHILL
related.Description: FALLCHILL can delete malware and associated artifacts from the victim.[52]

related.Name: FELIXROOT
related.Description: FELIXROOT deletes the .LNK file from the startup directory as well as the dropper components.[44]

related.Name: FIN10
related.Description: FIN10 has used batch scripts and scheduled tasks to delete critical system files.[114]

related.Name: FIN5
related.Description: FIN5 uses SDelete to clean up the environment and attempt to prevent detection.[111]

related.Name: FIN8
related.Description: FIN8 has deleted tmp and prefetch files during post compromise cleanup activities.[59]

related.Name: FruitFly
related.Description: FruitFly will delete files on the system.[35]

related.Name: Fysbis
related.Description: Fysbis has the ability to delete files.[104]

related.Name: Gazer
related.Description: Gazer has commands to delete files and persistence mechanisms from the victim.[57][58]

related.Name: gh0st RAT
related.Description: gh0st RAT has the capability to to delete files.[78]

related.Name: Gold Dragon
related.Description: Gold Dragon deletes one of its files, 2.hwp, from the endpoint after establishing persistence.[21]

related.Name: GreyEnergy
related.Description: GreyEnergy can securely delete a file by hooking into the DeleteFileA and DeleteFileW functions in the Windows API.[73]

related.Name: Group5
related.Description: Malware used by Group5 is capable of remotely deleting files from victims.[110]

related.Name: HALFBAKED
related.Description: HALFBAKED can delete a specified file.[53]

related.Name: HAWKBALL
related.Description: HAWKBALL has the ability to delete files.    [97]

related.Name: Hi-Zor
related.Description: Hi-Zor deletes its RAT installer file as it executes its DLL payload file.[45]

related.Name: Honeybee
related.Description: Honeybee removes batch files to reduce fingerprint on the system as well as deletes the CAB file that gets encoded upon infection.[109]

related.Name: HTTPBrowser
related.Description: HTTPBrowser deletes its original installer file once installation is complete.[70]

related.Name: Hydraq
related.Description: Hydraq creates a backdoor through which remote attackers can delete files.[38][39]

related.Name: HyperBro
related.Description: HyperBro has the ability to delete a specified file.[100]

related.Name: InnaputRAT
related.Description: InnaputRAT has a command to delete files.[41]

related.Name: InvisiMole
related.Description: InvisiMole has a command to delete a file and deletes files after they have been successfully uploaded to C2 servers.[34]

related.Name: Ixeshe
related.Description: Ixeshe has a command to delete a file from the machine.[95]

related.Name: JHUHUGIT
related.Description: The JHUHUGIT dropper can delete itself from the victim. Another JHUHUGIT variant has the capability to delete specified files.[15][16]

related.Name: JPIN
related.Description: JPIN's installer/uninstaller component deletes itself if it encounters a version of Windows earlier than Windows XP or identifies security-related processes running.[47]

related.Name: jRAT
related.Description: jRAT has a function to delete files from the victim’s machine.[23]

related.Name: Kazuar
related.Description: Kazuar can delete files.[19]

related.Name: KEYMARBLE
related.Description: KEYMARBLE has the capability to delete files off the victim’s machine.[30]

related.Name: Kimsuky
related.Description: Kimsuky has deleted the exfiltrated data on disk after transmission.[132]

related.Name: Komplex
related.Description: The Komplex trojan supports file deletion.[22]

related.Name: KONNI
related.Description: KONNI can delete files.[72]

related.Name: Lazarus Group
related.Description: Lazarus Group malware deletes files in various ways, including "suicide scripts" to delete malware binaries from the victim. Lazarus Group also uses secure file deletion to delete files from the victim.[113][63]

related.Name: LightNeuron
related.Description: LightNeuron has a function to delete files.[98]

related.Name: Linfo
related.Description: Linfo creates a backdoor through which remote attackers can delete files.[20]

related.Name: LockerGoga
related.Description: LockerGoga has been observed deleting its original launcher after execution.[88]

related.Name: Machete
related.Description: Once a file is uploaded, Machete will delete it from the machine. [101]

related.Name: MacSpy
related.Description: MacSpy deletes any temporary files it creates[51]

related.Name: Magic Hound
related.Description: Magic Hound has deleted and overwrote files to cover tracks.[121][122]

related.Name: menuPass
related.Description: A menuPass macro deletes files after it has decoded and decompressed them.[123][124]

related.Name: Misdat
related.Description: Misdat is capable of deleting the backdoor file.[83]

related.Name: MoonWind
related.Description: MoonWind can delete itself or specified files.[79]

related.Name: More_eggs
related.Description: More_eggs can remove itself from a system.[7][8]

related.Name: Mosquito
related.Description: Mosquito deletes files using DeleteFileW API call.[48]

related.Name: MURKYTOP
related.Description: MURKYTOP has the capability to delete local files.[37]

related.Name: NanHaiShu
related.Description: NanHaiShu launches a script to delete their original decoy file to cover tracks.[11]

related.Name: njRAT
related.Description: njRAT is capable of deleting files on the victim.[93]

related.Name: NOKKI
related.Description: NOKKI can delete files to cover tracks.[28]

related.Name: OceanSalt
related.Description: OceanSalt can delete files from the system.[50]

related.Name: OilRig
related.Description: OilRig has deleted files associated with their payload after execution.[107][108]

related.Name: OopsIE
related.Description: OopsIE has the capability to delete files and scripts from the victim's machine.[36]

related.Name: OSX_OCEANLOTUS.D
related.Description: OSX_OCEANLOTUS.D has a command to delete a file from the system.[56]

related.Name: Pasam
related.Description: Pasam creates a backdoor through which remote attackers can delete files.[46]

related.Name: Patchwork
related.Description: Patchwork removed certain files and replaced them so they could not be retrieved.[112]

related.Name: pngdowner
related.Description: pngdowner deletes content from C2 communications that was saved to the user's temporary directory.[68]

related.Name: PowerDuke
related.Description: PowerDuke has a command to write random data across a file and delete it.[74]

related.Name: POWERSTATS
related.Description: POWERSTATS can delete all files on the C:\, D:\, E:\ and, F:\ drives using PowerShell Remove-Item commands.[12]

related.Name: Proton
related.Description: Proton removes all files in the /tmp directory.[35]

related.Name: Proxysvc
related.Description: Proxysvc can delete files indicated by the attacker and remove itself from disk using a batch file.[63]

related.Name: Pteranodon
related.Description: Pteranodon can delete files that may interfere with it executing. It also can delete temporary files and itself after the initial script executes.[40]

related.Name: PUNCHBUGGY
related.Description: PUNCHBUGGY can delete files written to disk.[59][60]

related.Name: QUADAGENT
related.Description: QUADAGENT has a command to delete its Registry key and scheduled task.[14]

related.Name: RDFSNIFFER
related.Description: RDFSNIFFER has the capability of deleting local files.[106]

related.Name: Reaver
related.Description: Reaver deletes the original dropped file from the victim.[18]

related.Name: RedLeaves
related.Description: RedLeaves can delete specified files.[29]

related.Name: Remsec
related.Description: Remsec is capable of deleting files on the victim. It also securely removes itself after collecting and exfiltrating data.[25][26][27]

related.Name: RTM
related.Description: RTM can delete all files created during its execution.[65]

related.Name: RunningRAT
related.Description: RunningRAT contains code to delete files from the victim’s machine.[21]

related.Name: Sakula
related.Description: Some Sakula samples use cmd.exe to delete temporary files.[17]

related.Name: SamSam
related.Description: SamSam has been seen deleting its own files and payloads to make analysis of the attack more difficult.[87]

related.Name: SDelete
related.Description: SDelete deletes data in a way that makes it unrecoverable.[3]

related.Name: SeaDuke
related.Description: SeaDuke can securely delete files, including deleting itself from the victim.[49]

related.Name: Seasalt
related.Description: Seasalt has a command to delete a specified file.[80]

related.Name: ServHelper
related.Description: ServHelper has a module to delete itself from the infected machine.[91][92]

related.Name: Silence
related.Description: Silence deleted scheduled task files after its execution.  [131]

related.Name: SpeakUp
related.Description: SpeakUp deletes files to remove evidence on the machine.[89]

related.Name: SQLRat
related.Description: SQLRat has used been observed deleting scripts once used.    [96]

related.Name: StoneDrill
related.Description: StoneDrill has been observed deleting the temporary files once they fulfill their task.  [90]

related.Name: TDTESS
related.Description: TDTESS creates then deletes log files during installation of itself as a service.[32]

related.Name: TEMP.Veles
related.Description: TEMP.Veles routinely deleted tools, logs, and other files after they were finished with them.[129]

related.Name: The White Company
related.Description: The White Company has the ability to delete its malware entirely from the target system.[130]

related.Name: Threat Group-3390
related.Description: Threat Group-3390 has deleted existing logs and exfiltrated file archives from a victim.[116]

related.Name: TYPEFRAME
related.Description: TYPEFRAME can delete files off the system.[13]

related.Name: Ursnif
related.Description: Ursnif has deleted data staged in tmp files after exfiltration.[94]

related.Name: USBStealer
related.Description: USBStealer has several commands to delete files associated with the malware from the victim.[10]

related.Name: VERMIN
related.Description: VERMIN can delete files on the victim’s machine.[31]

related.Name: Volgmer
related.Description: Volgmer can delete files and itself after infection to avoid analysis.[77]

related.Name: WINDSHIELD
related.Description: WINDSHIELD is capable of file deletion along with other file system interaction.[43]

related.Name: Wingbird
related.Description: Wingbird deletes its payload along with the payload's parent process after it finishes copying files.[67]

related.Name: XAgentOSX
related.Description: XAgentOSX contains the deletFileFromPath function to delete a specified file using the NSFileManager:removeFileAtPath method.[71]

related.Name: Zebrocy
related.Description: Zebrocy has a command to delete files and directories.[84][85]

related.Name: Zeus Panda
related.Description: Zeus Panda has a command to delete a file.[62]

related.Name: zwShell
related.Description: zwShell has deleted itself after creating a service as well as deleted a temporary file when the system reboots.[76]

related.Name: ZxShell
related.Description: ZxShell can delete files from the system. [102][103]
